I wrote:
> It would help to have another set
> of eyes on the problems -- esp. the strange ".replace(/)" URIs affecting
> multiple hosts -- so please take a look at the output to see if you
> can figure out when/why things went wrong. 

I've discovered the problem, in a Javascript function common to at
least two hosts touched by this crawl that we're misinterpreting.

I would have definitely expected this problem to affect Mercator
as well -- though perhaps not to the same extent -- because our
regexp for guessing likely URI-paths in Javascript code is 
essentially the same. Igor, can you see if Mercator has(/had) the same
problem on the same pages?

Working on a fix,

- Gordon
